newsitem.title: UZBEKISTAN: Britain's Oxus Resources to mine Uzbek base metals.
newsitem.headline: Britain's Oxus Resources to mine Uzbek base metals.

text.p: British-based Oxus Resources Corp has signed a deal with Uzbekistan to mine base metals in the former Soviet republic, an Uzbek official said on Thursday.
Uzbekistan's State Committee for Geology and Mineral Resources has given Oxus the right to develop the Khandiz deposit in the republic's southern Surkhandarynsk region.

Alexander Ogarkov, head of the committee's geology department, said the deposit had reserves totalling 700,000 tonnes of lead, 1.54 million tonnes of zinc, 180,000 tonnes of copper and 2,300 tonnes of silver.
Oxus Resources must prepare a deposit for mining operations over the next year, after which Uzbekistan will sign a joint venture agreement with the comany, Ogarkov said.
He said added the project would require investment of $100-150 million.
